page.title: 09RECREATION
page.content: There is one recreation ground to the west of the town at Victoria Park. It has a playground for younger children. In addition, it has a bowling green, putting green, tennis court and a large open space for occasional cricket, football or rugby. There is another area of recreation to the south of the town at Cranley Gardens, which has similar facilities. The Docks area is now a Marina. It is still being developed and the buildings around consist of attractive brick built luxury houses, apppartments and flats with private moorings for pleasure boats. The Bridgwater Arts Centre was the first of its kind in the country and presents plays, musical evenings and varied entertainment for the town's folk.
